yats API

  • yats_define
  • yats_assign
  • yats_getbuf
  • yats_hide
  • yats_getvars

handle yats_define(string filename, string docroot)

load (and parse) a template

returns: template handle, or false if error

args:

filename: fully qualified path/filename of the template to be loaded
docroot: optional. document root for any sub-included templates. defaults to same directory as filename. So for a template to include another in a higher-level directory, the php code must explicitly allow it.


bool yats_assign(handle template, string key, mixed value) -- or --
bool yats_assign(handle template, array vars)

assign php variable(s) into template namespace for potential use

returns: true on success, else false

args:

template: template handle, as returned from yats_define()
key: variable name
value: variable value (scalar)
vars: list of variable name/value pairs. error if value without matching key is found.


string yats_getbuf(handle template [, string locale [, string gettext_domain [, string gettext_dir]]])

inserts assigned variables into template as appropriate and returns buffer. If a locale is given and gettext is properly configured and template contains {{text}}..{{/text}} tags, then this function will return localized strings.

returns: buffer containing fully processed template output

args:

template: template handle, as returned from yats_define()
locale: code for a valid locale installed on your O/S, eg es_ES. See GNU gettext documentation.
gettext_domain: filename of gettext messages file, without the path or extension. ie: messages, NOT messages.po. See GNU gettext documentation.
gettext_dir: root directory in which locale specific catalog directories are located. If ommitted default paths are searched by gettext. See GNU gettext documentation.


bool yats_hide(handle template, string section, bool hide [, int row])

sets hidden state of a named template section

returns: true on success, else false

args:

template: template handle, as returned from yats_define()
section: name of the section to hide/show
hide: if true, hides the section, else displays it
row: Optional. While looping, hide/show this section for specific row only. 1 based.


array yats_getvars(handle template)

returns list of variable names/values assigned to template thus far

returns: array on success, else false

args:

template: template handle, as returned from yats_define()
